A **robe of protection** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is made of [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather"), and has the [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") of a "colored robe" when unidentified.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Hack'EM info"*

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

[Master mind flayers](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer") have a 1⁄10 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a robe of power.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest"), [high priests](/wiki/High_priest "High priest"), the [Arch Priest](/wiki/Arch_Priest "Arch Priest"), and [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [priests](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)") may also generate with a robe of power.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Description

While worn, the robe of power confers 1 base AC and lowers spellcasting failure rates.

## Strategy

While it does not boost spellcasting success to the same rate as a [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe") does in vanilla *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the robe of power is still quite desirable for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") seeking out body armor.

## Encyclopedia entry

Robes are the only garments, apart from Shirts, ever to have sleeves. They have three uses:  
1\. As the official uniform of Priests, Priestesses, Monks, Nuns (see Nunnery), and Wizards. The OMT \[ Official Management Term ] prescribed for the Robes of Priests and Nuns is that they \_fall in severe folds\_; of Priestesses that they \_float\_; and of Wizards that they \_swirl\_. You can thus see who you are dealing with.  
2\. For Kings. The OMT here is \_falling in stately folds\_.  
3\. As the garb of Desert Nomads. \[...]

\[ The Tough Guide to Fantasyland, by Diana Wynne Jones ]
